From Wiktionary, the free dictionary

Catalan

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

Inherited from Old Catalan punir, from Latin pūnīre.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): (Central, Balearic) [puˈni]
  • IPA(key): (Valencia) [puˈniɾ]
  • Audio (Catalonia):(file)

Verb

[edit]

punir (first-person singular present puneixo, first-person singular preterite puní, past participle punit)

  1. (transitive) to punish
    Synonym: castigar

Conjugation

[edit]
    Conjugation of punir (third conjugation, with -eix-)
infinitive punir
gerund punint
past participle masculine feminine
singular punit punida
plural punits punides
person singular plural
first second third first second third
indicative jo tu ell/ella
vostè 		nosaltres
nós 		vosaltres
vós 		ells/elles
vostès
present puneixo puneixes puneix punim puniu puneixen
imperfect punia punies punia puníem puníeu punien
future puniré puniràs punirà punirem punireu puniran
preterite puní punires puní punírem puníreu puniren
conditional puniria puniries puniria puniríem puniríeu punirien
subjunctive jo tu ell/ella
vostè 		nosaltres
nós 		vosaltres
vós 		ells/elles
vostès
present puneixi puneixis puneixi punim puniu puneixin
imperfect punís punissis punís puníssim puníssiu punissin
imperative — tu vostè nosaltres vosaltres
vós 		vostès
affirmative — puneix puneixi punim puniu puneixin
negative (no) — no puneixis no puneixi no punim no puniu no puneixin

Related terms

[edit]
  • impune
  • punible
  • punició
  • punitiu

References

[edit]
  • “punir”, in Diccionari de la llengua catalana [Dictionary of the Catalan Language] (in Catalan), second edition, Institute of Catalan Studies [Catalan: Institut d'Estudis Catalans], April 2007
  • “punir” in Diccionari català-valencià-balear, Antoni Maria Alcover and Francesc de Borja Moll, 1962.

French

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

Inherited from Middle French punir, from Old French punir, from Latin pūnīre. May have been borrowed due to its late appearance.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /py.niʁ/
  • Audio:(file)
  • Audio (Switzerland (Valais)):(file)
  • Audio (France (Toulouse)):(file)
  • Audio (France (Vosges)):(file)
  • Audio (France (Lyon)):(file)
  • Audio (France (Somain)):(file)

Verb

[edit]

punir

  1. to punish

Conjugation

[edit]

This is a regular verb of the second conjugation, like finir, choisir, and most other verbs with infinitives ending in -ir. One salient feature of this conjugation is the repeated appearance of the infix -iss-.

Conjugation of punir (see also Appendix:French verbs)
infinitive simple punir
compound avoir + past participle
present participle or gerund1 simple punissant
/py.ni.sɑ̃/
compound ayant + past participle
past participle puni
/py.ni/
singular plural
first second third first second third
indicative je (j’) tu il, elle, on nous vous ils, elles
(simple
tenses) 		present punis

pluperfect2 imperfect subjunctive of avoir + past participle
imperative – tu – nous vous –
simple — punis
/py.ni/ 		— punissons
/py.ni.sɔ̃/ 		punissez
/py.ni.se/ 		—
compound — simple imperative of avoir + past participle — simple imperative of avoir + past participle simple imperative of avoir + past participle —
1 The French gerund is usable only with the preposition en.
2 In less formal writing or speech, these tenses may be found to have been replaced in the following way:
past historic → present perfect
past anterior → pluperfect
imperfect subjunctive → present subjunctive
pluperfect subjunctive → past subjunctive

(Christopher Kendris [1995], Master the Basics: French, pp. 77, 78, 79, 81).

Related terms

[edit]
  • punition

Further reading

[edit]
  • “punir”, in Trésor de la langue française informatisé [Digitized Treasury of the French Language], 2012.

Galician

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

From Latin pūnīre.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /puˈniɾ/ [puˈniɾ]
  • Rhymes: -iɾ
  • Hyphenation: pu‧nir

Verb

[edit]

punir (first-person singular present puno, first-person singular preterite punín, past participle punido)
punir (first-person singular present puno, first-person singular preterite punim or puni, past participle punido, reintegrationist norm)

  1. (transitive) to punish
    Synonym: castigar

Conjugation

[edit]
    Conjugation of punir
Singular Plural
First-person
(eu) 		Second-person
(ti) 		Third-person
(el / ela / Vde.) 		First-person
(nós) 		Second-person
(vós) 		Third-person
(eles / elas / Vdes.)

punindo
Past participle

Feminine punida punidas

Imperfect punía punías punía puniamos puniades punían
Preterite punín puniches puniu punimos punistes puniron
Pluperfect punira puniras punira puniramos punirades puniran
Future punirei punirás punirá puniremos puniredes punirán
Conditional puniría punirías puniría puniriamos puniriades punirían

Present puna punas puna punamos punades punan
Imperfect punise punises punise punísemos punísedes punisen
Future punir punires punir punirmos punirdes puniren
Imperative
Affirmative pune puna punamos punide punan
Negative (non) non punas non puna non punamos non punades non punan

Related terms

[edit]
  • punición

Further reading

[edit]

Middle French

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

From Old French punir, from Latin pūnīre, present infinitive of pūniō.

Verb

[edit]

punir

  1. to punish

Descendants

[edit]
  • French: punir

Occitan

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

From Old Occitan punir, from Latin pūnīre, present infinitive of pūniō.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • Audio (Béarn):(file)

Verb

[edit]

punir

  1. to punish
    Synonym: castigar

Conjugation

[edit]

This verb needs an inflection-table template.

Related terms

[edit]
  • punicion

Old French

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

From Latin pūnīre, present infinitive of pūniō.

Verb

[edit]

punir

  1. to punish

Conjugation

[edit]

This verb conjugates as a second-group verb (ending in -ir, with an -iss- infix). Old French conjugation varies significantly by date and by region. The following conjugation should be treated as a guide.

    Conjugation of punir (see also Appendix:Old French verbs)
simple compound
infinitive punir avoir puni
gerund en punissant gerund of avoir + past participle
present participle punissant
past participle puni
person singular plural
first second third first second third
indicative jo tu il nos vos il
simple
tenses 		present punis punis punist punissons punissez punissent
imperfect punissoie, punisseie punissoies, punisseies punissoit, punisseit punissiiens, punissiens punissiiez, punissiez punissoient, punisseient
preterite puni punis puni punimes punistes punirent
future punirai puniras punira punirons puniroiz, punireiz, punirez puniront
conditional puniroie, punireie puniroies, punireies puniroit, punireit puniriiens, puniriens puniriiez, puniriez puniroient, punireient
compound
tenses 		present perfect present tense of avoir + past participle
pluperfect imperfect tense of avoir + past participle
past anterior preterite tense of avoir + past participle
future perfect future tense of avoir + past participle
conditional perfect conditional tense of avoir + past participle
subjunctive que jo que tu qu’il que nos que vos qu’il
simple
tenses 		present punisse punisses punisse punissons punissez punissent
imperfect punisse punisses punist punissons, punissiens punissoiz, punissez, punissiez punissent
compound
tenses 		past present subjunctive of avoir + past participle
pluperfect imperfect subjunctive of avoir + past participle
imperative – tu – nos vos –
— punis — punissons punissez —

Descendants

[edit]
  • Middle French: punir
    • French: punir
  • → English: punish

Old Occitan

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

From Latin pūnīre, present infinitive of pūniō.

Verb

[edit]

punir

  1. to punish

Descendants

[edit]
  • Occitan: punir

Portuguese

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

From Latin pūnīre.

Pronunciation

[edit]
 
  • (Brazil) IPA(key): /puˈni(ʁ)/ [puˈni(h)]
  • (Brazil) IPA(key): /puˈni(ʁ)/ [puˈni(h)]
    • (São Paulo) IPA(key): /puˈni(ɾ)/
    • (Rio de Janeiro) IPA(key): /puˈni(ʁ)/ [puˈni(χ)]
    • (Southern Brazil) IPA(key): /puˈni(ɻ)/
 
  • (Portugal) IPA(key): /puˈniɾ/
  • (Portugal) IPA(key): /puˈniɾ/
    • (Southern Portugal) IPA(key): /puˈni.ɾi/

  • Audio (Brazil (Caipira)):(file)
  • Hyphenation: pu‧nir

Verb

[edit]

punir (first-person singular present puno, first-person singular preterite puni, past participle punido)

  1. (transitive) to punish

Conjugation

[edit]
    Conjugation of punir (See Appendix:Portuguese verbs)
Singular Plural
First-person
(eu) 		Second-person
(tu) 		Third-person
(ele / ela / você) 		First-person
(nós) 		Second-person
(vós) 		Third-person
(eles / elas / vocês)
Infinitive
Impersonal punir
Personal punir punires punir punirmos punirdes punirem
Gerund
punindo
Past participle
Masculine punido punidos
Feminine punida punidas
Indicative
Present puno punes pune punimos punis punem
Imperfect punia punias punia puníamos puníeis puniam
Preterite puni puniste puniu punimos punistes puniram
Pluperfect punira puniras punira puníramos puníreis puniram
Future punirei punirás punirá puniremos punireis punirão
Conditional puniria punirias puniria puniríamos puniríeis puniriam
Subjunctive
Present puna punas puna punamos punais punam
Imperfect punisse punisses punisse puníssemos punísseis punissem
Future punir punires punir punirmos punirdes punirem
Imperative
Affirmative pune puna punamos puni punam
Negative (não) não punas não puna não punamos não punais não punam

Related terms

[edit]
  • punição

Further reading

[edit]

Spanish

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

Borrowed from Latin pūnīre.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /puˈniɾ/ [puˈniɾ]
  • Rhymes: -iɾ
  • Syllabification: pu‧nir

Verb

[edit]

punir (first-person singular present puno, first-person singular preterite puní, past participle punido)

  1. (transitive) to punish
    Synonym: castigar

Conjugation

[edit]
    Conjugation of punir (See Appendix:Spanish verbs)
infinitive punir
gerund puniendo
past participle masculine feminine
singular punido punida
plural punidos punidas
singular plural
1st person 2nd person 3rd person 1st person 2nd person 3rd person
indicative yo tú
vos 		él/ella/ello
usted 		nosotros
nosotras 		vosotros
vosotras 		ellos/ellas
ustedes
present puno punestú
punísvos 		pune punimos punís punen
imperfect punía punías punía puníamos puníais punían
preterite puní puniste punió punimos punisteis punieron
future puniré punirás punirá puniremos puniréis punirán
conditional puniría punirías puniría puniríamos puniríais punirían
subjunctive yo tú
vos 		él/ella/ello
usted 		nosotros
nosotras 		vosotros
vosotras 		ellos/ellas
ustedes
present puna punastú
punásvos2 		puna punamos punáis punan
imperfect
(ra) 		puniera punieras puniera puniéramos punierais punieran
imperfect
(se) 		puniese punieses puniese puniésemos punieseis puniesen
future1 puniere punieres puniere puniéremos puniereis punieren
imperative — tú
vos 		usted nosotros
nosotras 		vosotros
vosotras 		ustedes
affirmative punetú
punívos 		puna punamos punid punan
negative no punas no puna no punamos no punáis no punan

1Mostly obsolete, now mainly used in legal language.
2Argentine and Uruguayan voseo prefers the tú form for the present subjunctive.

    Selected combined forms of punir

These forms are generated automatically and may not actually be used. Pronoun usage varies by region.
